parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication whether or not any data was collected for the intervention topic.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: General prompt question to aid in monitoring and data cleaning. This provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank. This is a field that can be used on any Interventions CRF to indicate whether or not there is data to record.
cdashModelFields.label: Any [Intervention]
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTM variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
cdashModelFields.name: --YN
cdashModelFields.questionText: Has the subject had any [intervention topic(s)] (after/before) [study-specific time frame] (after/before [study-specific time frame] )?; [Was/Were] (there) any [intervention topic(s)] [taken/performed/used/collected] (after/before) [study-specific time frame]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The topic for the intervention observation, usually the reported name of the treatment, drug, medicine, or therapy given during the dosing interval for the observation.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: If --TRT is pre-printed/pre-specified, the value should also be mapped into the --TRT variable (e.g., if Oral Steroid is pre-printed on a CM CRF, "Oral Steroid" should be stored in CMTRT). The CDASH field --TRT can also be used to collect any free-text values linked to the sponsor standardized value collected in the CDASH field --DECOD. For example, the CDASH field --DECOD may have a value of "OTHER" and the associated free-text intervention topic is collected in the CDASH field --TRT. In this scenario, the Item prompt "Specify Other" may be used.
cdashModelFields.label: Name of Treatment
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --TRT
cdashModelFields.prompt: [Treatment/Investigational Product/Intervention Name]; [Specify Other/Explain/Specify Details] [Treatment/Investigational Product/Intervention Name]
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the (type of) [treatment/investigational product/intervention topic]?; [If Other is selected], [explain/specify/provide more details].

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The dictionary or sponsor-defined standardized text description of the topic variable, --TRT, or the modified topic variable (-- MODIFY), if applicable.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: When populated by a coding dictionary (e.g., WHO Drug or MedDRA), Question Text and Prompt are not applicable. WHO Drug may be used for coding treatment names and MedDRA may be used for coding procedures. When these dictionaries are used, --DECOD is equivalent to those dictionaries' Preferred Term. The CDASH field --DECOD may be used to collect standardized pre-specified values (CDISC Controlled Terminology or sponsor-defined) on a CRF. The CDASH field --TRT can be used to collect any free-text values linked to the sponsor standardized value. For example, the CDASH field --DECOD may have a value of "OTHER" and the associated free-text intervention topic is collected in CDASH field --TRT.
cdashModelFields.label: Standardized Treatment Name
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --DECOD
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/ was] the [treatment/intervention topic]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C125923

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The mode or condition of the record that specifies whether the intervention (activity) is intended to happen or has happened.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: "SCHEDULED" is used when collecting subject-level intended dose records. "PERFORMED" is used when collecting subject-level actual dose records. This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If collecting both scheduled and performed dosing in the same horizontal record, the sponsor may append "_SCHEDULED" to the variable name to capture the scheduled dose.
cdashModelFields.label: Mood
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --MOOD
cdashModelFields.questionText: Does this record describe scheduled treatment or performed treatment?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically come from a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header. Examples are provided in the CDASHIG metadata table and in the SDTMIG.
cdashModelFields.label: Category
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --CAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the category (of the [intervention])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A sub-division of the --CAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. --SCAT can only be used if there is a --CAT. If a question is asked, the response would typically come from a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. Examples are provided in the CDASHIG metadata table and in the SDTMIG.
cdashModelFields.label: Subcategory
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --SCAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the subcategory (of the [intervention])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication that a specific intervention or a group of interventions is pre-specified on a CRF.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: For pre-specified interventions, a hidden field on a CRF may be defaulted to Y, or added during the SDTM dataset creation. If a study collects both pre-specified interventions and free-text interventions, the value of --PRESP should be Y for all pre-specified interventions and null for interventions reported as free text.
cdashModelFields.label: Pre-Specified Intervention
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --PRESP

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication that the pre-specified intervention happened or was administered when information about the occurrence of the specific intervention is solicited.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Used for specific interventions that are collected as defined by the protocol. If the term is pre-printed/pre-specified, the value should also be mapped into the --TRT variable (e.g., if Oral Steroid is pre-printed on a CM CRF, "Oral Steroid" should be stored in CMTRT). The CDASH field --OCCUR is not used for spontaneously free-text reported --TRT. Should not be used to indicate data was not collected. Used only when the value can be collected using values from the CDISC CT (NY) codelist. --OCCUR is a Yes/No variable and in the SDTM submission datasets, --OCCUR is populated only for the records where --PRESP is "Y" and is null when --PRESP is null.
cdashModelFields.label: Occurrence
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --OCCUR
cdashModelFields.questionText: Was [--TRT/ intervention] [taken/performed/administered/consumed] (after/before [study-specific time frame])?;Has the subject [had/taken/performed/administered/consumed] the [--TRT/ intervention]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The variable used to indicate whether data are available, by having the site recording the value as "Yes" or "No".
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Using --PERF, a negative response can be collected as "N" and mapped to the --STAT variable in SDTM as "NOT DONE". --PERF can be used instead of --STAT when a Y/N response list is needed for implementation. Examples: Were prior medications assessed? Were medications of interest assessed? \n
cdashModelFields.label: [Observation] Performed
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable --STAT to indicate when a pre-specified Intervention was not assessed. If the CDASH variable --PERF="N", the value of the STDM variable --STAT is "NOT DONE". If --PERF= "Y", --STAT is null.
cdashModelFields.name: --PERF
cdashModelFields.questionText: (Were/Was) (the) [intervention topic] [answered/done/assessed/evaluated/available]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The variable used to indicate that data are not available, by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The value of "Not Done" indicates either that data are not available or the question was not asked. Do not use this CDASH field when collecting information on whether or not a pre-specified intervention was performed; this should be recorded using the CDASH field --OCCUR.
cdashModelFields.label: Completion Status
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. If collected, the Origin (column in the Define-XML) = "CRF"; if populated from other sources such as a free text or sponsor-defined listing for --REASND, the Origin ="DERIVED".
cdashModelFields.name: --STAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: Was the [intervention topic] not [answered/done/assessed/evaluated/available]?; Indicate if ([intervention topic] was) not [answered/done/assessed/evaluated/available].

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An explanation of why data are not available.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology may be used. The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When --REASND is used, --STAT should also be populated in the SDTM dataset.
cdashModelFields.label: Reason Not Done
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --REASND
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the reason that the [Interventions topic/data/information/sponsor-defined phrase] was not [collected/answered/done/assessed/evaluated/available]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The condition, disease, symptom, or disorder that the intervention was used to address or investigate (e.g., why the therapy was taken or administered, why the procedure was performed).
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This additional information is collected on the CRF when the sponsor wants to capture the indication(s)/medical problem(s) why a subject took/had an intervention. This information can then be used as deemed appropriate for coding, analysis, or for reconciling the interventions as part of the data clean-up and monitoring process.
cdashModelFields.label: Indication
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --INDC
cdashModelFields.questionText: For what indication was the [--TRT] [taken/performed/administered/consumed]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The amount of substance (e.g., --TRT) given at one time, represented as a numeric value.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Used when the dose/amount taken/administered/consumed has only numeric entries. If non-numeric entries are possible, use the CDASH field --DSTXT.
cdashModelFields.label: Dose
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --DOSE
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/ was] the (individual) (intended) [dose/amount] (of [--TRT] [taken/performed/administered/consumed/per administration])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The amount of substance (e.g., --TRT) given at one time, represented in text format.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Defining this data collection field as a dose text field allows for flexibility in capturing dose entries as numbers, text, or ranges.
cdashModelFields.label: Dose Description
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Does not directly map to SDTM. Maps to either --DOSE or DOSTXT.
cdashModelFields.name: --DSTXT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the (individual) (intended) [dose/amount] (of [--TRT] [taken/performed/administered/consumed/per administration])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The unit for --DOSE, --DOSTOT, or --DOSTXT.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: When possible, this is pre-printed on the CRF with the associated treatment. Dose unit may be derived via other methods (e.g., from protocol, from data). When collected, the unit is pre-printed on the CRF or a field is provided on the CRF to capture it.
cdashModelFields.label: Dose Units
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --DOSU
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the unit (for the dose/amount of [--TRT])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66726

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The form in which --TRT is physically presented.
cdashModelFields.label: Dose Form
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --DOSFRM
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the dose form (of the [--TRT])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71113

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The number of doses given/administered/taken during a specific interval.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: When possible, the options for dose/amount frequency are pre-printed on the CRF. When collected, the recommendation is to collect dosing information in separate fields (e.g., --DOSE ,--DOSEU,--DOSFRQ) for specific and consistent data collection and to enable programmatically utilizing these data.
cdashModelFields.label: Dosing Frequency per Interval
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --DOSFRQ
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the frequency (of the [--TRT])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The total amount of --TRT taken over a day, using the units in --DOSU.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Used when dosing is collected as total daily dose
cdashModelFields.label: Total Daily Dose
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --DOSTOT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the total [dose/amount] (of the [--TRT/Intervention] [taken/performed/administered/consumed])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The text description of the intended dosing schedule for the administration of the intervention.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: When possible, the options for intended dose regimen are pre-printed on the CRF. The sponsor may wish to create a codelist to collect this data consistently. Example: TWO WEEKS ON, TWO WEEKS OFF.
cdashModelFields.label: Intended Dose Regimen
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --DOSRGM
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the intended dose regimen (of the [--TRT])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66729

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The route of administration of the intervention.
cdashModelFields.label: Route of Administration
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --ROUTE
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the route of administration (of the [--TRT])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Lot number of the intervention product.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The lot number identifies the manufacturing batch of the intervention product. In open-label studies, the reference number on the product container may represent an actual lot number and should be submitted using --LOT. This variable may be populated during the process of creating the SDTM submission datasets. Do not collect other identification variables in this field.
cdashModelFields.label: Lot Number
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --LOT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the lot number (of the [--TRT])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The anatomical location of an intervention (e.g., injection site).
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This may be pre-printed or collected. --LOC is used only to specify the anatomical location. --LAT, --DIR, --PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
cdashModelFields.label: Location of Dose Administration
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --LOC
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the anatomical location (of the administration/where the [intervention] was taken/performed)?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing side of intervention administration.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Further detailing the laterality of the location where the --TRT was administered/taken. This may be pre-printed or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of CT on the CRF.
cdashModelFields.label: Laterality
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --LAT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the side (of the anatomical location of the administration)?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99074

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Further detailing the directionality of the location where the --TRT was administered/taken (e.g., ANTERIOR, LOWER, PROXIMAL). This may be pre-printed or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of CT on the CRF.
cdashModelFields.label: Directionality
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --DIR
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the directionality (of the anatomical location of the administration)?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99075

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of).
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Further detailing the portion or totality of the location where the --TRT was administered/taken. This may be pre-printed or collected.
cdashModelFields.label: Portion or Totality
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --PORTOT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the portion or totality (of the anatomical location of the administration)?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.
cdashModelFields.label: Fasting Status
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --FAST
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Is/was] the subject fasting (prior to study treatment [being taken/administered/given])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The amount of an active ingredient expressed quantitatively per dosage unit, per unit of volume, or per unit of weight, according to the pharmaceutical dose form.
cdashModelFields.label: Pharmaceutical Strength
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --PSTRG
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the pharmaceutical strength (of the [--TRT])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The unit for --PSTRG.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The unit is pre-printed on the CRF or a field is provided on the CRF to capture it.
cdashModelFields.label: Pharmaceutical Strength Units
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --PSTRGU
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the unit (of the pharmaceutical strength (of the [--TRT]))?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The vehicle for administration of treatment (e.g., a liquid in which the treatment drug is dissolved).
cdashModelFields.label: Treatment Vehicle
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --TRTV
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the vehicle for administration of the [--TRT]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The amount of the prepared product (treatment + vehicle) administered or given.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Note: Should not be diluent amount alone
cdashModelFields.label: Treatment Vehicle Amount
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --VAMT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the amount (of the prepared product (treatment + vehicle) [administered/taken])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The unit of measurement for the prepared product (treatment + vehicle).
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The unit is pre-printed on the CRF or a field is provided on the CRF to capture it.
cdashModelFields.label: Treatment Vehicle Amount Units
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --VAMTU
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the unit?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The flow rate for the total amount of drug + vehicle administered to the subject.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Infusion rate can be used to derive dose.
cdashModelFields.label: [ --TRT] Infusion Rate
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This information could be submitted in a SUPP-- dataset as the value of SUPP--.QVAL where SUPP--.QNAM = "-- FLRT" and SUPP--.QLABEL = "Infusion Rate". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables (NSVs) in SDTM domains.
cdashModelFields.name: --FLRT
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the ([--TRT] infusion) rate?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The unit of measure for the flow rate for the total amount of drug + vehicle administered to the subject.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The infusion rate unit (e.g., mL/min) is pre-printed on the CRF or a field is provided on the CRF to capture it.
cdashModelFields.label: [--TRT] Infusion Rate Unit
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This information could be submitted in a SUPP-- dataset as the value of SUPP--.QVAL where SUPP--.QNAM= "--FLRTU" and SUPP.QLABEL= "Infusion Rate Unit". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.
cdashModelFields.name: --FLRTU
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the ([--TRT] infusion rate) unit?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: Description of or explanation for why a dose/amount of the intervention is adjusted.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The implementer may choose to create sponsor-defined controlled terminology such as Adverse Event, Insufficient Response, Non-medical Reason, etc.
cdashModelFields.label: Reason for Dose Adjustment
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --ADJ
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the reason the (study treatment/procedure) [dose/amount] was adjusted?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication whether or not the dose was adjusted.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Typically, the intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that the associated field on the CRF was deliberately left blank. However, the sponsor may collect whether the intervention was adjusted, without collecting the reason for the change.
cdashModelFields.label: Dose Adjusted
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTM variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED. If the Reason for Dose Adjustment is not collected, the sponsor might chose to submit this as a supplemental qualifier.
cdashModelFields.name: --DOSADJ
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Is/was] the (study treatment/procedure) [dose/amount] adjusted?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication whether of not the intervention was interrupted.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring when the actual duration of the interruption is collected using the CDASH field --CINTD. In some situations, if the actual duration of the interruption is not collected, or not derived, this information could be submitted in a SUPP--.QVAL dataset where SUPP--.QNAM = "--ITRPYN" and SUPP--.QLABEL = "Intervention Interrupted".
cdashModelFields.label: Intervention Interrupted
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTM variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
cdashModelFields.name: --ITRPYN
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Is/was] the [--TRT/Intervention] interrupted?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An explanation for why the scheduled intervention did or did not occur.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The reason the intervention did not occur may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., SUBJECT MISTAKE, SUBJECT REFUSED) or entered as free text. When --REASOC is used, --OCCUR must also be populated in the SDTM dataset with a value of "N".
cdashModelFields.label: Reason for Occur Value
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This information could be submitted in a SUPP-- dataset as the value of SUPP--.QVAL where SUPP--.QNAM = "--REASOC" and SUPP--.QLABEL ="Reason for Occur Value". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.
cdashModelFields.name: --REASOC
cdashModelFields.questionText: What was the reason that the [intervention topic] was (not) [performed/taken/done/administered]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication why the intervention was interrupted.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This CDASH field is use to collected the reason an intervention was interrupted. Sponsors may define their own controlled terminology.
cdashModelFields.label: Reason Intervention Interrupted
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This information could be submitted in a SUPP-- dataset as the value of SUPP--.QVAL where SUPP--.QNAM = "--ITRPRS" and SUPP--.QLABEL ="Reason Intervention Interrupted". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.
cdashModelFields.name: --ITRPRS
cdashModelFields.questionText: Why was the [--TRT/Intervention] interrupted?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The collected duration of the intervention interruption.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This CDASH field is use to collected the duration of an intervention interruption. In some situations, the duration of the interruption may not be collected but calculated from the intervention start and end times recorded elsewhere in the CRF.
cdashModelFields.label: Interruption Duration
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPP-- dataset as the value of SUPP--.QVAL where SUPP--.QNAM = "--ITRPD" and SUPP--.QLABEL= "Interruption Duration". Concatenate the collected intervention interruption duration and the duration unit components and create --ITRPD using ISO 8601 period format. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.
cdashModelFields.name: --CINTD
cdashModelFields.questionText: What was the duration of the [--TRT/Intervention] interruption?; How long was the [--TRT/Intervention] interruption?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The unit for the collected duration of intervention interruption.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The unit is pre-printed on the CRF or a field is provided on the CRF to capture it.
cdashModelFields.label: Interruption Duration Unit
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPP-- dataset as the value of SUPP--.QVAL where SUPP--.QNAM = "--ITRPD" and SUPP--.QLABEL= "Interruption Duration". Concatenate the collected intervention interruption duration and the duration unit components and create --ITRPD using ISO 8601 Period format. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.
cdashModelFields.name: --CINTDU
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the (interruption duration) unit?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication of whether or not the subject completed the intended regimen.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This could be used when treatment is given as a fixed number of cycles and the sponsor needs a flag to indicate that the treatment has been completed as planned.
cdashModelFields.label: Completed Treatment
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This information could be submitted in a SUPP-- dataset as the value of SUPP--.QVAL where SUPP--.QNAM = "--TRTCMP" and SUPP--.QLABEL ="Completed Treatment". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains.
cdashModelFields.name: --TRTCMP
cdashModelFields.questionText: Did the subject complete [treatment/ the full course/sponsor provided phrase] (of the [--TRT/Intervention])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78738

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

sdtmClassMappingTargets.title: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
End Relative to Reference Time Point

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication of whether the substance was used and when it was used.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The preferred SDTM mapping is provided. This information is usually not submitted in a SUPP--.QVAL dataset.
cdashModelFields.label: Never Current Former Usage
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable --OCCUR. If --NCF = "Never", the value of --OCCUR will be "N". If --NCF = "Current" or "Former", the value of --OCCUR will be "Y". May also be used to populate a value into an SDTM relative timing variable such as --STRTPT or --STRF. If the value of --NCF is "Former", the value of ""BEFORE" may be used. If the value of --NCF is "current", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When populating --STRTPT, if the value of --NCF is "Former", the value of "BEFORE" may be used. Note: --STRTPT must refer to a time point anchor described in --STTPT. This variable may also be used to populate the SDTM ending relative timing variables.
cdashModelFields.name: --NCF
cdashModelFields.questionText: Has the subject ever [used/consumed] [--TRT/Intervention]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

sdtmClassMappingTargets.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

cdashModelFields.definition: An indication whether the intervention is ongoing as of a given timepoint when no end date is provided.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: The CDASH field --ONGO allows specific question text/prompt about interventions ending after the study or after a given timepoint. Select the appropriate text when designing the CRF. This may also be included in the CRF title or instructions. Used in conjunction with either a reference timepoint (--ENTPT, --ENRTPT) or in conjunction with the Study Reference Period (described as RFSTDTC to RFENDTC). May also be used as a tick/checkbox. See CDASHIG Section 3.7 for more information.
cdashModelFields.label: Ongoing Intervention
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTM relative timing variable such as --ENRF or --ENRTPT. When populating --ENRF, or --ENRTPT, if the value of the CDASH field --ONGO is "Y" a value from the CDISC CT (STENRF) may be used. When --ONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC), the SDTM variable --ENRF should be populated. When --ONGO is compared to another timepoint, the SDTM variables --ENRTPT and --ENTPT should be used. Note: --ENRTPT must refer to the time point anchor described in --ENTPT.
cdashModelFields.name: --ONGO
cdashModelFields.prompt: Ongoing (as of the [Study-Specific Timepoint or Period])
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Is/Was] the [--TRT/Intervention] ongoing (as of [the study-specific timepoint or period])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A free-text comment.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: If an additional free-text field is needed to provide a comment about a particular record, use the COVAL(n) field to collect the free text, and associate the free-text comment with the original record using SDTM variables RDOMAIN, IDVAR, IDVARVAL, COREF. See the SDTMIG for more information.
cdashModelFields.label: Comment
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM dataset, the CDASH variable --COVAL maps to the SDTM variable COVAL (COVAL2, COVAL3) in the CO domain. Associate the free-text comment in the CO domain with the original record using RDOMAIN, IDVAR, IDVARVAL, COREF.
cdashModelFields.name: COVAL
cdashModelFields.prompt: [Abbreviated version of the protocol-specified targeted question]
cdashModelFields.questionText: [Protocol-specified Targeted Question]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: If the value for --TRT is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This is not a data collection field that will appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package.
cdashModelFields.label: Modified Treatment Name
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --MODIFY

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The class for the intervention, often obtained from a coding dictionary.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This is not a data collection field that will appear on the CRF itself. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process (e.g., WHO Drug). This would generally be the class used for analysis.
cdashModelFields.label: Class
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code interventions, using Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin column in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".
cdashModelFields.name: --CLAS

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The assigned dictionary code for the class for the intervention.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This is not a data collection field that will appear on the CRF itself. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process (e.g., WHO Drug). This would generally be the class used for analysis.
cdashModelFields.label: Class Code
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code interventions,, using Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin column in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".
cdashModelFields.name: --CLASCD

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The first level of hierarchy within the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical (ATC) Classification System; indicates the anatomical main group.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This is not a data collection field that will appear on the CRF itself. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process (e.g., WHO Drug). Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package. This is an example of variables that could be used in the CM domain for coding. Other dictionaries can be used and the appropriate coding elements added, if appropriate, in the SUPP--.QVAL dataset.
cdashModelFields.label: ATC Level 1 Description
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This information could be submitted in a SUPP-- dataset as the value of SUPP--.QVAL where SUPP--.QNAM= "--ATC1" and SUPP--QLABEL= "ATC Level 1 Description". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains. Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".
cdashModelFields.name: --ATC1

cdashModelFields.definition: MedDRA primary SOC code.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using the MedDRA coding dictionary. Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package. This variable could be used in the PR domain for coding. Other dictionaries can be used and the appropriate coding elements added, if appropriate, in the SUPP--.QVAL dataset.
cdashModelFields.label: Primary System Organ Class Code
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This information could be submitted in a SUPP--dataset as the value of SUPP--.QVAL where SUPP--.QNAM = "--SOCCD" and SUPP--.QLABEL = "Primary System Organ Class Code". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of NSVs in SDTM domains. Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".
cdashModelFields.name: --SOCCD

description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2021-06-25)
label: Interventions
name: Interventions
